title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
description: When I create a new data set without an SQL statement and then change the data source in the data set editor, the new data source does not provide any information on databases, tables, or columns. As a result, there are no children nodes listed in the data set editor page of the query tab. Closing and reopening the data set editor does not resolve the issue.
OB: No children node listing when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
EB: I expect to see the children nodes listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. Open the data set editor and go to the data source page.
3. Change the data source to a new one that has no database, table, or column information.

Expected result:
- The data set editor should display the children nodes with information about the databases, tables, and columns from the new data source.

Actual result:
- No children nodes are listed in the data set editor page of the query tab.
- Closing and reopening the data set editor does not resolve the issue.
